    level="1"

>
[Mother Maw](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2384)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Cursed" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=274" />
<trait label="Extradimensional" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=67" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 192 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** placed on a surface

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This item appears to be and functions as a [_portable hole_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2195), but it's actually the maw of an alien extradimensional creature akin to and older than a [_bag of devouring_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=598). Any animal or vegetable matter put in the hole has a chance of triggering the creature's interest. Whenever you reach into the hole to retrieve an item or place an animal or plant product within the bag, roll a DC 11 flat check. On a success, the hole ignores the intrusion. On a failure, the _mother maw_ devours the triggering material, removing it from existence. The maw can't eat [artifacts](/Traits.aspx?ID=253). If the triggering material isn't entirely inside the maw, such as when someone reaches inside, the _mother maw_ attempts to pull it completely inside using a [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) action with a +28 [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) bonus. On a success, it devours the victim or object.

 Whenever the maw critically fails the Athletics check, it regurgitates one creature or object it previously devoured. The condition of the vomited creature or object depends on its resilience and the time it has spent inside the maw. Typically, the maw spews forth items it finds difficult to digest, such as those made of [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=271) or protected by magic. It can and does regurgitate remains, though.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
